Basic details: Mary Johnson, a 55-year-old female, comes to the ED complaining of abdominal pain.
Vitals:
BP: 140/90 mm Hg
Temp: 99.1°F (37.3°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 88/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Lie on the bed and exhibit pain.
Place your hands on your abdomen.
Exhibit mild discomfort when moving.
If ultrasound is mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What is an ultrasound?”
Challenging question: “Is this something serious? Do I need surgery?”
